column5: My numbers are the only important ones to me.Â  	if I get it what are my chances , I can go with age and health too when only 16 had the virus and 1 person diesÂ to say who cares itâ€™s one in 2 million if it stay at 1 death for every 16 Â that is a know fact Â Other numbers are just a snapshot of the day And I donâ€™t know why youâ€™re thinking whether or not you have something against me what does that got to do with a conversation

Everything has to be taken in context.Â  I understand different viewpoints, but I have a problem when rights and freedoms are taken away by things not being taken in context. What are the chances of Joe Schmoe dying in Ontario from Covid?  BTW, I simply said I have nothing against you.

And I find when people say they have nothing against someone, it usually means they do but will try to not hold it against them you seem to be making itÂ personal as I said my numbers are important to me i never said Â your numbers were unimportant usa death per m Â 186 canada 79 per m but as you said 	guess we win

Regardless of what the number is, it should still be the focal point of concern. IMHO there is no acceptable number regardless of what the total population is.Â  	Covid 19 knows no borders. Itâ€™s the virus against humans. So the only percentage that really matters is the one that includesÂ world totals. Hence the entire argument regarding social distancing...no one is in this alone and ourÂ actions influence others.
I don't disagree, by the same token raw numbers are thrown out for sensationalism and ratings. If the actual fatality rate was used, it wouldn't be as sensational.

Huh? Are you saying the death toll is artificially inflated for ratings??? Seriously?? The numbers are on aÂ US governmentÂ website and Iâ€™m 100% positive the big kahuna there wants anything but Covid sensationalism.

I didn't say that at all.Â  I said raw numbers with no correlation to population are being used for ratings. Especially now that NY is counting "suspected" corona deaths with no facts in the official count. 45,000 sounds much more sensational than .00014% of the population.

Im not exactly sure who you are saying wants to sensationalize it? Media? Maybe. So why isnâ€™t the gov.com website saying .00014%? If anything, they absolutely want to minimize the impact Â to protect their positions.
Yes the media is doing it to sensationalize.  Why do you need a website.Â  45000 divided by 330,000,000 = .00014%.Â  I simply used a calculator.
Youâ€™re missing my point
Isnâ€™t 45,000Â out of a population of 330,000,000 actuallyÂ .0136% ?
Not by the calculator that I used. https://calculator.com/standard-tape/
Suggest you revist your grade 6 memories on how to calculate percentages...
remember...to get % you move the decimal over 2 places...so I would say .0136%
I agree with those saying .0136.
That is fine, it is still a minuscule number.  I concede that I was wrong on the decimal point.Â  Yay for y'all.

But the .0136 is the percentage of death for the whole population not the percentage of those infected which would be far higher. But we have no way of determining how many were/are infected as there isn't wide spread testing.
I thought Ontario has almost 16000 cases and almost 10000 deaths seems like one in sixteen isÂ fatal

Who knows how many are actually infected.Â  This entire deal is a manipulated numbers game to support agendas regardless of which side of the fence you are on.  Me, I am going to live my life taking into account China flu, but in no way is it going to put a halt to my normal life. I understand folks like to take potshots at the US, it has always been that way.Â  You can only apply infection and fatality rates to the entire population to get a true picture.  If you take European countries, lump them together to get to a population number equal to the US, their fatality rate is double.
Ontario has had a total of 996 deaths as of today. https://covid-19.ontario.ca/?gclid=EAIaIQobChMIlo-1peOO6QIVPyqzAB2slgjyEAAYASABEgLP6PD_BwE#section-0
Yeah I know ,have the sameÂ info . but to make it easy for the math geniuses here I rounded up to make it easy to do the calculations

Again, you can take numbers and prove anything.  Ontario has about a population of 14.5 Million with 996 deaths.  Florida has a population of 20.2 million with 1218 deaths with the oldest population in the US.  Who is winning?
From where I sit you can only count the deaths per number of people who have had the virus letâ€™s face it ,if you donâ€™t catch the virusÂ the chances of death from covid is 0

Terry that's only based on confirmed deaths with a confirmed infection. They are not testing everyone by far. Those effected without symptoms unless working with or exposed to a confirmed infectedÂ  person do not get tested. No way to confirm a percentage of those infected that die. Information is just not there.

I will be sure and send you a pic of when I am at the cottage in June after I have been told here that it can't happen.  I have nothing against you and if you want to hang your hat on a decimal point, enjoy.

No meat shortage here today. Felt good to cast again. buckshot tipped with a minnow head under a float. They are still deep and staging. Caught close to 20 perch too but we donâ€™t get those simcoe giants.

So jealous man we're getting close to the in between stage.Â  Still safe ice in certain areas but it's leaving quick. So glad there's 500 lakes within a half hour drive and I bet I wouldn't see another soul on 499 of them.
Only boats I saw were contractors heading in after their day at work. Construction guys havenâ€™t slowed down during this thing.

I can see both sides.Â  It's a good point about reducing traffic, thereby reducing accidents.Â  On the other hand, BC's provincial health officer Dr. Bonnie Henry recommends getting outside as a way get through this because it supports physical and mental health.Â  I was out yesterday at an isolatedÂ river location.Â  Felt great to be outdoors for a day and I didn't break any social distancing rules.Â  The Humber river multi-use trail near my placeÂ is steady with people.Â  On the weekends it can be challenge to maintain 2 metres.

Not sure Canada dodged aÂ bullet. Â Majority of US cases are in NYC/NJ area, whose total population is bigger than a lot of Countries.Â  Compare the stats of US population to Canada. Â In my State of Ohio, population of 12 million,Â our numbers are very low and we still allow fishing and golfing, which both are much safer than going to the local crowded parks or Costco/Grocery stores. Â We also start opening up on May 1st, slowly, but you can not keep living like this forever, otherwise their will economic collapse. Banning fishing is ridiculous, especially Lake fishing. Â People just need to make sure they are practicing social distancing and if they are not, like in some rivers, then the locality should shut those down. When I fish in Ohio, it is on a bank and there is no one else around. Â Virus canâ€™t spread that way. Â Same as golfing, my course has a lot less people than a park and you donâ€™t touch anything except your club. No need for such extreme rules and Ohio is proof of that as are other States. Â  If people are that paranoid, then stay in your house, but donâ€™t let your paranoia ruin it for others that are practicing safe social distancing. Â  Â Crazy - you canâ€™t keep living in fear. I look at Sweden and some other CountriesÂ too and they have some of the least stringent rules and are surviving still without closing anything.

So COVID-19 is a bullet and is hitting every country differently. We are faring reasonably well so far henceÂ the expression "dodged a bullet so far" which fitsÂ fine for me. Fishing isn't banned here and I'm not paranoid. I simply said I was fishing locally where there will be no other anglers. Â If you're from Ohio you have really have no idea about the Ganny. Fishing shoulderÂ Â to shoulder is not an exaggeration.

I do though. Â My family and I have been fishing in the Rice Lake for over 50 years, multiple times a year and over Canadian Thanksgiving too. Â Also, other areas of Canada, like Kesagami, skiing out west, etc.... Â Â Love the Ganny and love Canada! Â I always feel it is my second Country and always brag about Canada to everyone, since we travel their so much!! Hate seeing those people fishing shoulder to shoulder snagging fish and that is what I am talking about. Â Your local municipality could ban fishing their then, so those are the people that would usually abuse it. Â They did it in some of ourÂ rivers this spring.

Okay so you do know the circus lol As far as I know the localÂ municipalityÂ has now restricted all public access now, if so it will be private propertyÂ only. I don't even go there for the opener on a non-COVID year!

I didn't see to much wrong with the article, written by someone who makes his living fishing. There are plenty of fishing related things we can do without endangering anyones health, take me for instance. ..last week i changed the line on all 34 of my reels 3 times, rewired my boat twice and sharpened the hooks on all 9342 of my crankbaits.

He has slipped on a rock while fishing. This needlessly exposes our front line people to possible carriers. And I know some will say you can slip in your shower but at least you areÂ local. We don't need people coming into town just to go fishing. I have a boat sitting in the driveway I can't use and I'm content to do that till this is over. Just my opinion.

The blog was an attempt to do my part in helping us rid ourselves of this scourge called COVID-19. With the upcoming opening of trout season (April 25th) in most parts of Ontario, I thought we as anglers should be proactive and postpone the opening until we have a better handle on when we can resume some sort of normality. LISTEN TO ANGELOâ€™S RADIO RESPONSE HERE Our biggest concern was spreading the virus on opening night along the many tributaries that dump into our Great Lakes. Those of us not in denial all know the sh&$?t show that is opening of trout season in southern Ontario on the banks of the Ganny, Wilmot, and Credit to name a few. I thought that giving up fishing for a few more days or even weeks would be a small price to pay considering what we have all given up already. Due to the reluctance of theÂ government to suspend the trout opener, I thought the unselfish act from the angling community would be greatly appreciated by the folks who have lost family members, lost jobs, lost businesses, and have put their lives on the line every day as first responders. Evidently, I thought wrong, and for that, I must apologize. I apologize to the good people who were exposed to the garbage and vile behavior of the handful of keyboard warriors that saw fit to violate the Fishâ€™n Canada digital properties last Wednesday. I apologize to the advertisers and supporters of the Fishâ€™n Canada brand who were bombarded by these misguided souls at a time when our sponsors have far more pressing concerns, like the welfare of their employees and families. But most importantly I apologize to those of you who were led to believe that theÂ Fishâ€™n Canadashow has now somehow becomeÂ anti-fishing. To those people I say please read the blog again, I may be guilty of a lot of things but turning my back on fishing and the Fishâ€™n Canada audience is not one of them. Calling people that would not be willing to give up the trout opener, whiny, sniveling little brats, I admit may have been a little excessive. Not considering that the folks from remote parts of the province, where little to no fishing pressure is present, can, in fact, go fishing without violating the pandemic protocols. To all of you that fall into these categories, my most sincere and heartfelt apologies. Finally, to the keyboard Warriors (and I now know who you are) that started all of this I only ask that you reflect on your actions of last week and know that although we may not always agree with each otherâ€™s views and opinions we do have a commonality that bonds us, the love of the outdoors and the passion to fish, let us not tarnish those great qualities. If you are venturing out on Trout Opening, be safe and enjoy! Thank you and be safe out there.
I can remember going to Lake X with dad about 50 years ago and catch a pile of them off his friends dock in early May.Â  I learned how to clean fish pretty quick.

Look at Michigan.Â  They have a problem with the Detroit area but impose the most draconian rules in the country on the entire state.Â  The UP ain't Detroit.

I live on the edge of a lake, have my own launch, only fish with my family members. Iâ€™m going fishing, Â if the damn ice ever melts ğŸ˜„

As I said before, I am deemed anÂ "essential" worker. I work in a car parts plant making parts for cars. I'm currently off as the plants we supply to in the states are closed, or just re-opened, so there are no orders yet. When I am there, I am working beside someone, on some of the lines as close as 2 feet apart, passing parts to the next person and them to the next person and so on, assembly line work.Â How anÂ industry like this is essential in times like this is beyond me, but the government says it is so I will have to return to work when they need me. If I can go to work and work in those conditions, protective equipment or not, then I can trailer my boat 3 hours to an area where I will see, maybe a handful of people all day, not stopping for anything there and back. I will be using much more common sense in doing so, than the government and my company are using in requiring me to work to make parts for vehicles that aren't selling right now.
big guy I'm in the same situation but work more on the maintenance end. Until orders start again we are shut down.

Fishing season will open as usual in Ontario in May. Thatâ€™s according the premier Doug Ford. In an exclusive interview with Acadia News, he says though they arenâ€™t encouraging any fishing tournaments at this time, due to physical distancing protocols as a result of COVID-19. â€œFishing will still be open, but the fishing derbies, weâ€™re requesting, weâ€™re not putting an order in, but I think itâ€™s common sense, we donâ€™t want the fishing derbies to happen.â€ While a number of boat launches are closed, Ford is encouraging anglers to get out, mind their physical distances and fish from shore. â€œIf people want to make sure of their social distance and theyâ€™re on the shore and they want to throw a reel and hook in the water then by all means.â€ Walleye season is scheduled to open the third Saturday in May. You can listen to the full interview with Premier Ford below. https://www.895thelake.ca/2020/04/16/130396/?sc_ref=facebook&fbclid=IwAR0LhruiZ6fCpEiap0aPLpc1Y0yXMUAhtBpeoRc4_PHEeIej4944lqKETMM

Well first of all, didnâ€™t the municipality of port Hope just close the river access anyways? most of the ramps are closed in Ontario. I personally think any public dock should also be closed to avoid contact with moorings. but to stop fishing entirely for people with private access to lakes, or that can access via some other means...use your common sense.  im not holding my breath though that the river rats ruin it for everyone else next week when they flock in droves to park accesses etc that are closed. whatâ€™s strange to me is that fishing regulations have no problem applying wildly different rules for various bodies of water and species but the fishing debate is somehow singular all or nothing? call me crazy but joe blow going out in a canoe with his kid on a lake somewhere is far far different than everyone stacking up on the pier at port dal.
